Header: Met Dept predicts an afternoon of thundershowers
Content: The Meteorology Department says that thundershowers, about 150mm will develop over most parts of the country after 2 p.m. A number of reservoirs have reached spill level as a result of the heavy showers experienced. Eight spill gates of the Rajanganaya Reservoir were opened on Monday night. The engineer in charge stated that six gates were opened up by 4 feet each and two gates gave been opened by two feet each. Two spill gates of the Angamuwa Reservoir have been opened as well. Our correspondent said that the water levels of the Mahaweli river has risen in the Manampitiya area. The reading in the water gauge was at 17 feet for the Mahaweli River. Director general of the Irrigation Department Mohan Raj stated that water will be released from reservoirs to maintain the water levels in reservoirs below spill level. Thereby, this program to release water will be in effect in the Veheragala, Lunugamvehera, Muruthalawa, Senanayake Samudraya, Deduru oya, Rajanganaya Thabbowa and eleven other reservoirs. He added that this measure will not pose a risk to the people living in low lying areas. He added that this measure was taken to ensure that dams do not break free, and as a preparation of the monsoon rains.
